Head straight for bed?
1.content:
A layer of the summer night's warmth embraces your face as you exit the air conditioned confines of your Malibu Max. You swing the car door adjacent to the driver's seat shut, releasing a soft sigh and grimacing after a long and exhausting day of scholarly persuits. An old three pouch back pack hangs from a strap off of your shoulder. Shifting slightly, the strap slides up closer to your neck, relieving you a bit from the dull pain put on from the pressure of the three hard covered course books inside your pack.

Sauntering down the dirt path that leads to your parent's porch, you are serenaded by the chirps of the crickets that surround your two story farm house. You pay no mind to the beautiful canvas of stars above, your mind set on relaxing in the comforts of your home. You carry yourself up the the three wooden stairs that leads to your bleach painted porch. Following the two paralell railings on the top platform, you unlock your door with your house key and proceed inside.

There is no luxury sweeter on a summer's night then central air. You can't help but bite your bottom lip and fondly gasp at the chilling air that blankets your skin. Briefly glancing to your left, you spot yourself in the long bodied mirror near your front door.

You stand 6 foot tall, your skin tanned from exposure to the sun. Your hair is cut short, raven black, and your eyes are hazel green. Your attire consists of a pair of dull khaki shorts and a black an white striped polo shirt. Your name is Demetri Larson, you are twenty-one years of age and you are living with your parents. You go to college at a small community institute and live in a southern Michigan farm home a few miles from a lake community.

Your back pack lets out a thump as you drop it in the corner of your white carpeted living room. A yawn escapes you, followed by a slight struggle to keep your eyes open. You've had a busy day, and with the assignments given today, you're looking to a busier one tomorrow. Looking to the the T.V set do you..
1.title: The Night Before

choices: You tremble slightly, worried for your parents, you call your parents.
You set upon the task of arming yourself and locking all the doors.
It's no big deal, you're going to go sleep and catch the reports in the morrow.
11.content:
In the four years you've owned the living room sofa, not once had it been an advocate of your discomfort. Sinking into the cushions, you rest your head on a pillow while turning the television on. With a soft buzz the television presents a picture. Two white middle aged news anchors stand before a desk, behind them video footage of what they describe to be nation wide pandemonium.

With a bead of sweat rolling off his brow, the male anchor says, "The president has called upon a State of Emergency as the nation has errupted into delirium. Mass riots have taken ahold of nearly every major city. As of yet, we do no know what is the cause of such violent hysteria, but we urge everyone to remain in doors while civil defense units get ahold of the situation."

The camera pans away from the speaking anchor, the montage of chaos and destruction now displayed fully on the screen. It was odd, as you watched image after image of destruction, you couldn't exactly tell how you felt. This wasn't a joke, something was going on. Your eyes remained glued to the T.V, as you traced the list of unsafe cities streaming across the screen. Adrian, the city your parents work, and the city no more then 10 miles away was listed on the screen.
11.title: Dreadful News

choices: Prepare yourself, then journey over to your girlfriends house in town.
Stay home, lock the doors, and prepare for any intruders.
111.content:
Relieving yourself from the comforts of your sofa, you rush from your living room over to your kitchen. Barreling across the black and white checkered tile floor, you snatch your cordless telephone from it's bed and quickly dial your parent's cell phone.

The dial tone goes off in your ear, your ancipation displayed as you anxiously tap your foot. Suddenly, the dial tone stops and an automated message plays, telling you they are not available. You try once more, still to no avail. Third times charm? Nothing. Cursing aloud, you try for the local athorities, hoping you'll get an answer. The busy tone denies you any absolution.

Your fingers quickly go about the task of calling your girlfriend Melissa, but then it hits you. Her parents haven't paid the telephone bill. Again, cursing the procrastination of your girlfriend's father, you are left with a decision...
111.title: Pick Up, Damnit!

choices: You notice several people running down the street and you stop.
You notice several people running down the street and you don't stop.
1111.content:
You're not about to sit back and allow your girlfriend to get stuck in the middle of this riot! You head into your garage where there is a ton of stuff to dig through. You spot a few hatchets, shovels, baseball bats, and an array of power tools. There is also a large duffel bag to your right. You grab the bag and begin tossing the various items inside.

You run back inside and grab a dozen water bottles from your fridge and some food, just in case. After opening the garage door a figure begins hobbling toward the house. You barely notice it and throw everything into your car and take off.
1111.title: Rescue

choices: You swerve left.
You swerve right.
11111.content:
You pull over and wait for the people to walk up to your window, there are three of them, two guys and a girl to be exact. They are younger than you, probably around 16 years old. They seem panicked, and very tired. One of the guys approaches, "My name in Adam..." pointing to his companions " Mike and Angela, my brother and sister. Please, give us a ride...we'll explain..."

You figure that if there is actually a riot going on you could use some people to help you out.

The three of them pile into your car, Adam sits in the passengers seat.

"Come on man, go!"

You look over at him in disbelief, and notice that he is a fairly big guy. He is wearing a football jersey from the local highschool, spattered with blood. Not wanting to question why....you drive.

Adam begins to explain why they were running in the middle of the night. Apparently his mother had been bitten by a homeless man after work. Her leg was bleeding pretty badly and they had managed to bandage it at home only moments before she began to catch a fever. 911 was busy taking care of injuries from the riots in the city, so their father told them to go to their rooms and he would look after her for the rest of the night. Several hours later they heard screams coming from their parents room, opened the door and found their mother over their father covered in blood. Their father managed to shout at them to get out of the house before their mother had begun to disembowel him. So they ran...

Adam shouts at you to watch out!
11111.title: Savior

choices: "Fine by me, anywhere you want me to take you?"
"I need to stop by my girlfriend's first, sorry..."
111111.content:
You jerk the steering wheel to the left, sending your car skidding off the road and down a ditch and into an empty field. You look through your rear view mirror, spotting the darkened silhouttes of what you make out to be an abandoned car. If it wasn't for Adam, you'd of no doubt hit it.

Your heart begins to race as the tread of your tires kick up clumps of dirt and grass. You look to Adam, his face pale from the night's events. Everything seems so unreal, you can't help but question everything that is going on. Adam's story alone sent a shiver down your spine, but how could it be true?

It's obvious the three of them were siblings, for all of them sported a golden crown of curly locks. Their eyes were blue, and each of them seemed to be in physical shape. Ofcourse, Adam appears the dominant of the three, and no doubt the most coherent.

Speeding across the field, you shoot a glance towards Adam and the remenants of his family. You ask, trying to keep your voice from break, "Is everyone alright?"

Adam, holding is siblings in a protective embrace, their eyes irritated from crying, replies with a nod, "We just want to get out of this town.."

Nodding your head, you say ...
111111.title: Off the Deep End

choices: cautiously enter the cabin armed, with the siblings covering you.
let the kids go check it out while you keep the car on.
1111111.content:
Mike suddenly chimes in, his voice meek, low and timid, "Well.. We have an Uncle who owns a hunting lodge a few miles from here.."

He and his sibling look amongst each other, as if they're processing the idea by measuring each other's facial expressions. Finally, after each one gives a nod, Mike continues, "I can give you the directions.."

A dull pain eminates from the bottom of your stomach. You don't necessarily like the idea of abandoning your girlfriend, but these kids are in need, and after such a traumatic experience, you don't want to expose them to any more danger. If anything, after you insure they are safe, you can go and retrieve your girlfriend.

Your Malibu Max rumbles violently as it spans across the empty field. The shake jerks the lot of you back and forth, but you're still able to keep the control of your car with relative ease. After passing through the field, you merge into an open road and follow the directions given to the siblings.

After a twenty minute drive, you find yourself coursing over a dirt road surrounded by dead trees. Your only source of illumination stems from your head lights and the pale moon that filters through the gaps of the tree branches above. You recognize the environment, as it's always the cliche wooded setting for horror movies. Blair Witch, eat your heart out.

You eventually come to a clearing, and from that you find what appears to be an abandoned lodging. The home is made entirely of wood with a few glass pane windows set around it. In front of the wooden construct is stump with a rusty ax wedged into it. The area is small, but it looks as if it should provide some decent shelter. It doesn't appear as if anyone has taken residence inside, due to the darkness that dwells within. Do you...
1111111.title: Blair Witch, eat your heart out.

choices: go for the axe
wait on the siblings to return
11111112.content: you begin thinking to yourself "was the drive out here really worth it...." as you sit there thinking you realize that the siblings took all the tools with them and left you defenseless. you sit there and think "should i go for the axe or wait in them to get back...." you didn't remember seeing any zombies on the way here but you aren't sure how many people lived here and where the zombies might have moved to since the first attacks.....
11111112.title: safety or axe, tough choice

choices: pull harder to try and free the axe and face the noise
quickly get back into your car and lock the doors

You tell them about all of the weapons that you brought, which seems to relieve them slightly, but not enough. Adam manages to calm his siblings down and agrees to help you find your girlfriend.

They unzip the bag. Adam takes out the hatchets and hands them to his siblings, while he holds onto the shovel...you continue on to the city.

Push onward.

Lights on to ward off the descending darkness, the four of you make solid progress until you realize that your gas tank is running low on fuel. This realization hits you as you are nearing a gas station that looks to be open.

a scream from the car, more behind you!

You turn off the road and pull up to the pump. you get out and go to the pump, it's one of the new ones so you just swipe your credit card your parents gave you for your 21st birthday and punch in your pin. you take the gas cap off and put the nozzle in, the gas starts pumping and you notice movement inside the station you then notice the gas truck abandoned, it's hoses still leading to the tanks under ground, this strikes you as odd and you look back at the station. More of the people have appeared and seem to be trying to get out to you, there are 5 of them. one of them finds the door and pushes it opened and then starts to shamble torwards you.

when it gets into the light the color drains from your face, it's the gas station attendent and half his face is a bloody mess. a chime comes from the pump telling you your tank is full.
you...

You head for your girlfriends house....which is in the direction of the sounds.
11111122.content:
You figure it has to be faster if you want to get to your girlfriend before anything happens. You head for the main road into the city, it doesn't necessarily show any signs of riots...in fact, everything appears to be calm. The streets are covered in papers, and a few windows are broken...but everyone must be sleeping or maybe they were evactuated, whatever the case you need to find your girlfriend, in the middle of the city.
As you drive you begin to hear the sounds of gunfire and screaming. You slow to a stop to figure out where it's coming from, just as several police cars fly across the intersection...moving away from the noise?
11111122.title: Enter deadmen

choices: "Adam and I are going on foot.. You two protect the car and keep it running.."
"We're going to find another road..."
111111222.content:
Melissa, beautiful Melissa. The way she dressed, how she acted, she was a living breathing statement of uniqueness over conformity. Her hair the color of amethyst, her face a painting of exuberance and beauty. A glow would always come off the both of you when you held in embrace. She was your muse, she was your everything. At least that's how you felt... You had to save her.

Four state police cars followed by three county squads? The wail of gunfire? Things were getting too intense. It was a small city, not a construct to scrape the sky, nor a diverse multitude of people to flood the streets. It was once a calm little area, but Adrian had a fire in it's belly, and it would take a lot of medicine to settle it.

You sit uncomfortably at your vehicle's helm, the leather upholster of your wheel stir's nervously under your tight grasp. A moment is all that is needed to make your decision. Trailing behind the police may be safe, but Melissa was more important. With an inhale, you took in all the courage your lungs could hold. Turning the wheel to the left, you make your way down the street at a slow cruise.

Odd, you expected rioters, but the streets were empty set aside rubble and debris. The street lights that tower above provide no illumination, go figure. The power of your head lights cut through the darkness, revealing a chaos swept illustration. Abandoned cars lay dormant on the streets, providing slight obstacles to avoid. Shrill screams flooded the air from a few blocks away and disheartening feel comes about you. This is unreal.

Melissa lives in the suburban area of the city. Taking the street you normally take presents you with a congregation of abandoned vehicles that blocks your path. A futile attempt to mar your rescue effort. There may be another street that leads to the suburbs, you may also pass the pile up on foot, her home is not far from here.

"What's the plan?" Adam asks, his voice weak at the thought of having to leave the safety of the car.
111111222.title: My Melissa.

111112.content: You quickly jerk the wheel to the right, narrowly escaping a compound pile up of cars only to hit headlong into a leafy oak monolith. The collision snaps you forward, and the last thing you see before going black is your dash board.
111112.title: Tree!!!

11112.content:
You speed past the panicked people on the side of the road. You have your own problems to deal with, right? The speedometer has nearly reached 75 mph as you twist and turn down the road into the city where your girlfriend lives. The street that you are on appears to be deserted and dark. Wait, that is odd. Why are all of the streetlight--BAM!

Before you have a chance to finish the thought you slam into the back of an abandoned vehicle. At the speed you were traveling, your car is flung into the air on top of a car a few feet up the road. As you are in mid-air you make out what appears to be a line of stalled out cars on the road. The impact knocks you unconcious, unfourtunately you cannot do much while you are unconcious and that includes defending yourself. Soft moans come from out in the darkness and grow louder....until the windows shatter revealing several hands.

You come to and realize that you have probably broken both of your legs, your wrist, several ribs, and an asortment of other things.

It's too bad you didn't have anybody in the car to warn you about the pileup...

Unable to move, the last thing you see is the body of a little girl with matted blonde hair and milky eyes drag herself over to you and lunge at your throat, ripping everything out. You struggle for several moments as everything turns a fuzzy red color, all attempts at screaming result in a muffled gurggling sound as the blood comes rushing from your throat.

Everything goes black.
11112.title: rescue2

choices: headed back to your living room to watch more reports.
.. headed upstairs to sleep.
1112.content:
The house has two doors of entrance, the back door in the kitchen, and the front door that leads to the living room. There is one large window in the living room, and a series of windows around the kitchen. There are also a number of windows upstairs, but you discredit the idea of dealing with those windows. With an absent sigh, you abandon the thought of saving your girlfriend, reassuring yourself that she'll be fine. Things can't be that bad, can they?

Never the less, it's best to take certain precautions. Your eyes drift over to a multitude of ginsu knives harbored individually in seperate slots of a knife holder. You grasp the one with the largest handle and slide out a stainless steel butcher's knife. Sliding the blade into your pocket, you go about the task of locking every door, and window.

With every entrance locked, you let out a sigh of relief. Were you now safe? Was it safe to rest? You then...
1112.title: Home Security

choices: That's enough TV for the night, time for bed.
You decid to turn out the lights and call one of your friends from school.
11121.content:
The news has changed to an on site interview of a police officer in full riot gear.
News caster:"can you explain the reason behind why these people are rioting?"
Officer:"As of yet we have no information to explain these people behavior, but we urge all people to stay in their homes and lock the doors and window."
Newscaster:" What do you have to say to the reports that some of the rioter are eating people?"
Officer:"as i said we have neither confirmed or--"
You jump as an officer in riot gear tackles the officer on camera and bites his neck, you then hear gunshots as the feed cut back to the two anchor men in the studio.
Anchorman 1:"we seem to have lost the feed, we will try and find the problem and will get back to you after this break, this is Channel 6 news." the news station's logo plays across the scream and it cuts to a commercial.
The site of the cop attacking the other has shaken you up.
you decided.....
11121.title: The reports

Secure the house and then find a weapon.
112.content:
You begin to think of what could happen if this riot headed for your house. Your parents will probably be back sometime later anyway...

A thought comes to your mind: block the door and windows!

You begin to think of how you are going to secure the house...
112.title: Securing

choices: Take firearms.
Leave firearms.
1121.content:
Wanting something quick and sturdy, you grab the cast-iron fireplace poker from its place near the hearth. Three feet of cool black iron does much to calm you as you move from room to room, locking windows and drawing blinds. The doors dead-bolted, you move upstairs and try to remember everything you might have learned from the Boy Scouts about being prepared.

As you check the upstairs windows, you pick up a flashlight and decide that your school backpack might be a better home for items other than books. You are peering out of the window in your parents' bedroom when you make this decision. It quickly leaves your mind as you see a person stumble in the street outside, then three others jump on that person. A scream tears through the night from the fallen man, then stops suddenly.

Terrified, you look around your parents' room and stare at the night stand. You know your father keeps a pistol there, as well as a hunting rifle and shotgun in his closet. You've gone shooting with him before, so you know how to handle the weapons, but he will have your ass if he finds out you've been messing with his things while he is out.

Then again, you think about those people attacking that man, and also about that terrible scream that you can never unhear.
1121.title: Find a weapon and then begin securing.

choices: Pistol
Shotgun
11211.content:
The haunting scream is still in your mind as you hesitate. A thump, then a crash downstairs makes your mind up for you. It must be those people breaking through the front window!

Heart pounding, you rationalize that Dad will understand your getting his guns. Moaning and clattering from below make you realize that they are already inside. You've only time to grab one weapon and load it before they clamber up the stairs and find you.

Which one? The .38 revolver, the Mossberg 500 12 ga. shotgun, or the Marlin .30.30 lever action hunting rifle?

You can already hear them moving up the stairs.
11211.title: Take firearms.

Shutting the T.V off with the click of a button, the screen fades to black, leaving you with the muffled chirps of crickets. Your eyes heavy, fatigue sweetly tells you to set them down to rest. Content with darkness, you fall into slumber, a rest ever so desired by the weary.

You are roused from your sleep by the squeek of a naked palm running across your living room window. Your vision blurry, you let out a groan as you lift your body from comfortable shackles of sleep. Birds chirp in the background, setting a melodious ambient tone, highlighting peace and uprising. That pleasantness is quickly shattered by the the loud thump of a hand smashing across your window. Instinctively, you shoot a glance towards the sound, your eyes widening as your ocular perception adjusts to the ghastly view before you.

A man stands outside your window, looking in at you with a pair of pale blue eyes. His form leans against your window and it's wooden frame. A crimson soaked wife beater adorns his upper torso, above it a deep tear in his neck. He appears extremely pallid, his face void of emotion. With a shrill and distant cry, his smashes his hand against the window once more, causing the glass to shift against the assualt. Oddly enough, it looks as if he has stopped bleeding from the wound on his neck. Either way, this man is hurt, and it looks as if he needs help.

Should you...

With all the power you can muster up, you attempt to yank away from your attackers grip. Still, even then his iron grip remains tightly around your wrist. You try to flee, but he reels you in. Terror courses through you as the man bares his teeth, sinking them into your neck. Pain jolts, assualting your brain and causing you a mind numbing head ache. The fibers of your flesh wear away as he grinds his teeth and tears a chunk out of you. Warm scarlet pumps out from the open wound and before you know it, your body is trembling so much that you can't move.

With a shudder, you cry out softly, "No.. please.."

But his answer comes in the form of gaping mouth, that quickly closes in on your face..


The End.

1132.content:
This man needs help, but you can't help him without helping yourself first. In a flurry of terrified movement you roll off of your couch and head frantically towards the dark hall that leads towards your parent's bedroom. As you transcend into the shadows you grasp the wall to make sure nothing foreign lingers beyond the dark. You can hear the shards crumble down off of the window sill from behind you. This fact hastens your pace, and moves you further into your parent's room, no longer fearing the scenes from movies, but the very real danger that might be standing right now in your living room.

You feel the edges of the room until you brush against the glossy wood of the closet door. Opening the door, you grab wildly and recover a shoe box which had been hidden there for years. Your father had recently purchased the pistol inside for self-protection, ever since he had been robbed by the gang of unruly youths. Opening the box, you pushed the old pornagraphy aside, and held the pistol straight out, aiming it towards the living room. You listened for the intruder, but couldn't hear a thing, except for the cricket's chirps which only seemed to be escalating the situation further.

You creeped forward, sweat developing all over you, from the intense fear of this epidemic. You gathered all the courage you could so that you could face this danger with confidence, and not let your guard down. Out of warning, and hoping for control of the event, you call out to the unwelcome guest,

"I think you have the wrong house, sir! Please leave or I'll call the police!"

After setting your digital alarm clock for the afternoon, you lay yourself over your bed and fall out of conciousness. Your eyes quickly snap open, revealing a distorted and groggy display of your room. A muffled smack sounds out, and it appears to be coming from downstairs. You decide to sleep...

121.title: How could you sleep?

choices: Back door!
Front door!
1212.content:
It was the news, but it seemed a lot less organised than usual. The man behind the desk was jumpy and kept flicking his eyes to someone behind the camera;

“A State Of Emergency has been called as the infected increase in number, already the army have been mobilised to larger areas, we have been assured that we will receive our own detachments of armed forces soon, mean while government officials urge everyone to stay indoors and not make contact to those acting strangely or moving with awkward movements. Those who have been bitten and/or scratched by the infected recommend bandaging the wound and wrapping something round the top of the limb restricting blood flow to the area.

Again, we are seeing a horrible epidemic spreading through the city, we have reports that is happening nationwide, it seems the brain loses higher functions and the infected have a urge to attack the nearest uninfected. The virus we can speculate is passed through scratches or bites directly from an infected host. We have been informed that those already bitten will receive medical attention and that a cure to the virus is being sent to us via fastest routes. We would like to…”

The man who was now obviously very worried was cut off by someone screaming and unearthly moans coming from the TV. The reporter stood up and took off running, obviously other people were as one knocked over the camera and sent it spinning, in finally stopped moving showing many, if not hundreds of feet, some with shoes missing, others walking on what appeared to be broken limbs, but what was certain was that they were moving with sluggish movement and seem to be oozing a dark crimson liquid, it must have been blood, but there was defiantly something wrong with it.

Gasping you take a step back from the TV as if to put yourself further away from the horror of what you can only think that the infected of the new virus must have gotten into the broadcasting station, as you flick through the rest of the stations you find each having technical difficulties or just static on. Not good…

“Ok, I should stay inside, like the man said… W-what was that?” You started to reinsure yourself before hearing a quiet groan from somewhere outside. Feeling fear blossom inside of you, you don’t think of looking out a window to check you flee, flying into the hall you head for…

121222.content:
The sun shines brightly through your windshield as you watch as your arms violently shake behind the wheel of your vehicle. You haven't been this tense in a long time, and you don't even know what the hell is going on. Every so often you quickly glance to wards the rear view mirror, a brief moment of comfort washes over you as the unidentified cluster of people near your home shrinks into the horizon.

Who were those people? You've never seen them before in your life, and living in such a small community makes it easy for you to recognize faces. Then it hits you, the Races. Every year the races comes to the stadium near your city, hundreds of tourists come in.

A drive would be good, you think to yourself, something to compose you as you clear your head. You decide not to take the road to the city and make a turn to wards the farmlands. Despite the insanity of the beginning day, you can't help but notice how beautiful the environment looked. The fresh exuberance displayed by the drifting grass, the cloudless sky, it was peaceful.

With a few moments of silence, you reflect on the words 'epidemic' and 'infection.' They embed themselves into your mind. What was going on? It made no sense. It's then you make a dreaded realization, your parent's car weren't parked in the dirt drive way. Your bottom lip quivers at the thought of any harm being done to your parents.

You reach for your cell phone but..

"Fuck!" You scream out, you left it at the house. Your fist slams against the steering wheel, your teeth clenching as you soak up all the frustration. It's not long until your anger is wiped away by a hard jolt of fear. In the distance, you spot a mini-van and a camper turned over in the middle of the road. Coming closer reveals the haggard form of a man bent over something you can't exactly tell what. Do you...

Finally realising the safety was on; you flick it off then take aim at the man whose now grabbed your leg. The pistol makes a loud ringing sound sounding like a cannon had gone off in the quiet countryside air. But the results were more violent. First the gun bucked in your hands hurting your wrists as you were unprepared, the man’s skull explodes in a spray of red ooze, but at that point he instantly dropped and stopped moving, but the cop although he’s witnessed a murder moves along slowly unphased.

“Please, don’t… Stop! I don’t want to shoot you!”

He…

12122211.content:
'I'm a murderer.. I killed someone... Oh my god, oh my god.. Oh my god.. I killed someone..'

A splatter of dark crimson cakes around the officer's uniformed attire. Just by his appearance you can surmise that he's a neat and organized guy. His auburn colored hair takes in the golden rays from the sun as every lurching step towards you brings you a closer visage of horror. The slim slit of well trimmed hair above his upper lip remarks upon him wanting to be like the cliche mustache wearing road cops you see in films. A thick pair of sun glasses further adds to this assumption. The darkened shades conceal his eyes, while the handles cross between his temple and the lump of wet flesh that hangs off his cheek. From this distance, you can only compare him to road kill.

"P-p--please!" You cry out, a tear now streaming down your cheek. What the hell was going on? Nausea takes it's toll, as the events of the morning weigh heavy on you. Your perfect world was on the verge of being flushed away.

Before he can respond, an explosive cry lets out, causing the officer's face to break apart like a sledge hammer smashing a ripe melon. The sound numbs your ears for a moment, and you can't make of what happened. The effect of the blast sends the officer reeling backwards, a gush of scarlet trailing his descending fall. Within a manner of seconds he lies motionless on the pavement. The sight sparks a fire in your belly, and before you know it you're vomiting off the side of the road.

"Are you alright, boy?" Sounds a voice carried with the burden age. The barrel of your 9mm quickly jerks from the corpse over towards the voice. With a shotgun now resting on his shoulder, there stands a thin bodied man who appears to be in his late fifties. Wrinkles course about his face, his hair graying, he exhudes a warm grandpa demeanor. His attire consists of a pair of hiked up jeans and a button up long sleeve shirt.

You can tell how horrible you sound, your voice cracking and waning at the pace of your sobs, and still you can not do anything about it. "I..What's going.. on?"

"I'm not sure.. But my car is parked behind the wreckage and I don't live too far from here. If you'd like, I can take you somewhere safe."

122.content:
A rhythmic songs of thumps pace out as you descend your stair case. With a longing yawn, you fill your lungs with oxygen while groggily rubbing your eyes with your knuckles. As you reach the bottom step, you acknowledge that the smacks you had heard earlier this morning have now increased in decibel, providing a bit of dissonance that wracks your nerves. As you proceed into the living room, you turn your head towards the window and suddenly realize where the noise was emanating from.
Releasing an audible gasp, you stagger backwards, tripping over your feet and landing safely into the embrace of your sofa. Between you and pane of blood smeared glass a pair of hollow and diluted eyes stares at you. They belong to a ghastly looking man dressed in blood soiled attire befitting to that of a farmer. His hands slide down the window, issuing out a squeak as their descent is marked by a smear of scarlet.
Your mind begins to race as a series of questions lash out at you. Who was this unidentified intruder? What the hell is he doing? What is wrong with him? It looks as if he is hurt, and might need help. That would give him proper cause for such actions; still, he isn’t verbal about his plight aside from a projection of distorted moans. You remember you have a first aid kit in the bathroom, should you tend to him and then call 911? Or vice versa?

info.brief_description: Can you survive a Zombie Holocaust?
info.description:
Your name is Demetri Larson, you are a 21 year old college student living in a rural setting near a lake community. Your skills are limited and you're not very brave. You are currently living with your family in southern Michigan, your parents work days and you barely see them.

Aslo, realize these zombies are slow and shamblers, also as dumb as a rock. One bite and you'll be hooked. The city near you is a small one, so it's not exactly too large. Also, they live in a farmland area as well as the epidemic is just starting, so the chaos will not be that bad.

It is a summer climate. New characters are welcomed, no outrageous stuff, this is just the beginning of a zombie apocalypse.
